Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 49 Grove Street, CB 2, Application no. 2010551 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.

Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 49 Grove Street, Manhattan (2010551 TCM)

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):

Report of the Committee on Finance
Resolution to establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one percent (1.0%) per annum for Fiscal Year 2012.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one percent (1.0%) per annum for FY'12.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for Fiscal Year 2012 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than two hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000), or not more than two hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000) per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for FY'12 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than ($250,000), or not more than ($250,000) per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2012 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for FY'12 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2012 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $250,000, or not more $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate to be charged for FY'12 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $250,000, or not more $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartme

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2012 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate to be charged for FY'12 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: STATED MEETING - JUNE 14, 2011

Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2012 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $250,000, or not more $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate to be charged for FY'12 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $250,000, or not more $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartme

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Office of Children and Family Services to extend the maximum length of stay at emergency shelter residential programs for victims of domestic violence to not less than 180 days.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Women’s Issues
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: NYS Office of Children and Family Services to extend the maximum length of stay at emergency shelter residential programs for victims of domestic violence to not less than 180 days.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of pending legislation in the New York State Legislature, which would amend the Penal and Criminal Procedure Laws by creating the E felony of aggravated domestic violence when an offender is convicted of two or more specified domestic violence offenses within five years.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered -  Adopted by the Committee on Women’s Issues
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Creating the E felony of aggravated domestic violence when an offender is convicted of two or more specified domestic violence offenses within five years.
